p: Increasing human-animal interactions have amplified the likelihood of cross-species infections and spill-over events [ 24]. Epidemiological links of the three coronavirus outbreaks point to the human-animal interface, highlighting the importance of considering prevention strategies with an integrated approach such as “One Health” [ 25]. The One Health (OH) approach considers the human-animal-environmental interdependence through multi-sectoral collaborations [ 26] and recognizes that prevention and “ zoonotic disease control programs are most effective when the broader socioeconomic and ecological determinants of health are included” ([ 27], p. 66).
